answerText: post-translational modification (accept PTA; accept word forms)[10] One post-transcriptional modification involves the addition of multiple copies of this nucleotide to the 3-prime end of a pre-mRNA transcript. This nucleotide bonds to thymine in DNA and uracil in RNA.
heading: SUBMIT |2014 | Yale A, OSU A | 12 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question:  [10] Name these processes that occur after a polypeptide leaves a ribosome, examples of which include glycosylation,succinylation, ubiquitination, and phosphorylation.
